The loan that will take out now is to increase her working capital (to buy calves) that she will purchase in the agricultural shows nearby her community and later on to rear the calf and produce products that she will sell in her sales area. This form of work will enable her to generate an income to support her home as much as possible as she is married and has three children. 

When asked what it is that she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training in health and loans.

loans.use: to buy baby calves.

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en: Mr. Jargalsaikhan, 47 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in house on plot of land. He has been making and selling wooden products to local people since 2003. His elder three children all got married and live on their own. He is requesting a loan of 4200000 MNT to purchase planks and other raw materials in large amount. This business is the main income source for the family and he is searching for ways to increase work efficiency.

loans.use: to purchase planks in large quantity

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza is 45 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.  Feliza works very hard to provide for them.

Feliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

Feliza has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, shampoo, rice and other groceries. 

In the future Feliza would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Aghasi

texts.en:
Aghasi is from Gyumri town where he lives with his wife and son. He has been working as a taxi driver for many years and sustains his family with the income he gathers from that business.
He works for local company who is providing transportation service to the locals of Gyumri town. Realizing the importance of his business and taking into account that it is the only source of income for the family, Aghasi wants to purchase his own car. The income that Aghasi gets is hardly enough for covering family's daily costs, so he was able to save little money for purchasing new car. For the other part of money he has applied to SEF for a loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, this loan is very important for Aghasi to be able to purchase a minibus and enlarge his business. 
Aghasi hopes for lenders' trust and support.

loans.use: to pay for new minibus

loans.name: Simba Group

texts.en:
Hamza is in his thirties and married with three children.  Two of the children go to school and one is a baby.  For three years, Hamza has been running a grocery store and he works from 6:00am to 8:00pm everyday.  This business gives him a good monthly profit.  

This will be Hamza's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used his previous loans to increase his store and buy more inventory like chairs and tables.  He has paid back all his previous loans successfully.  He used his profit to pay for school fees, covered household expenses, and build a small house.  He also bought a TV, music system, and DVD player.  He will use this loan to increase stock for his grocery business.  His dream is to expand his grocery store by adding another room.  

HAMZA will share this loan with his loan group "Simba" which consists of 6 members.  The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock for grocery business.

loans.name: Berita

texts.en: Berita is 50 years old and she lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married business lady with four adult children. For more than ten years now her business has been tailoring and this business is her sole source of income.  She knew Milango through friends and she decided to join so that she can save and access funds for her business.  She now seeks a loan to buy cloth material for her business. She hopes that her business will grow to be stable in the next five years. The extra income she will raise will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy cloth material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and firewood

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is thirty four years, married to Joseph and a mother of five children. She is a pig farmer and also has rental houses. She has been in this business for five years now and gets a monthly income of forty five thousand shillings.

This will be Susan's third loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to pay school fees for one of her children. In future she wants to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en: Lidia is 56 years old, married and a mother of four children. She operates a cafe in Mpeketoni, Lamu town and has been in the business for the last seven years. She earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES. Shen is applying for her fifth loan of 30,000 KES. Lidia intends to use the loan to add food stuff such as cooking flour, cooking oil, cereals and items such as eating plates, tea cups, spoons and so on for her business. She will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for her younger children. In the future, Lidia hopes to grow her cafe with a view of owning a well set-up hotel in the area.

loans.use: To purchase additional items needed for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be humble and trustworthy. She operates a green grocery and cereals shop where she sells groceries and cereals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a water storage facility. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water barrel to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit the three members of her family. This will enable them access water easily. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water barrel

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years married with 9 children and 3 dependents. He is an agriculturalist who majors in cattle fattening in his region and owns 30 cows. Alongside cattle fattening, James carries out coffee growing on a large scale where he owns 4 hectares of coffee plantation. This has helped him to look after his family and also paying of school fees for his 2 young brothers due to the inability of the parents to look after them because they are aged. 
James is applying for a loan of 4,000,000shs to buy materials for finishing up his house and be able to have a decent living together with his increasing family.
James’s major challenge is the poor housing condition at the moment with his nine children, James lacks a decent house. “My house can’t accommodate my large family. Given 4,000,000, I will be able to finish my house and live a happy life,” said James.
His dream is to own one of the largest farms in his region producing 300 liters of milk a day. 
James is honest and a hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is 34 years old and married with four children. She sells secondhand clothes, and she has been in the business for more than five years. Her husband is also supportive of her business, and she is happy about that. Salama hopes that her business will grow into a reputable boutique in five years' time. She knows Milango through friends, and she is now seeking a loan to buy bales of secondhand clothes for resale. The major challenge in her business is customers who do not pay on time. The extra income she will raise with the help of the loan will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, 34, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jordan, a vendor, and they have children. Together with her husband and children, the family manages their own business to be able to meet their everyday expenses.

Editha operates newsstand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Editha is requesting a PHP 8000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more newspapers to sell.

Editha hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers for her newsstand.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley, a father of six from Thika, runs a business supplying arrowroots (taro). He is married to Alice, who helps him in selling the arrowroots. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family. Stanley also practices farming. This will be his first loan term with KADET. 

With the requested loan from KADET LTD, Stanley will be able to purchase more arrowroots to supply to his customers. Additional income created will allow him improve the standard of living for his family and pay college fees for his daughter. In the future, Stanley would like to build a permanent house for his family. 

He hopes to save money to provide his children with a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase more arrowroots

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en: Mrs. Altantuya, 39 years old, lives with her cohabitant in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has divorced her husband and her son now lives with her father in a border city between Mongolia and China. She has been working as a conductor on a bus since 2008. She is requesting a loan of 7000000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, she will repair and insulate her house thus improving her living environment. Also the renovated house will enable the couple to burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Batchimeg is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Batchimeg has been working as a project planner at an aviation company. Her husband is unemployed and looks after the children, who are second-year students in high school. 

The family resides in an apartment. Since moving into the apartment, they have not performed any renovations, and over the years it has deteriorated badly. Batchimeg is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass, wallpaper, and foam. Using those materials, her husband can make good renovations to their house. After the repair, the family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will use less energy for heating.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass, and wallpaper

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from the town of Gyumri, where he lives with his wife. Artur has been working as an electronics repairman for three years. Due to the good work that he performs, he has many orders and a good client base. 

Because the family's only source of income is Artur's work, it is very important for him to have essential tools for repairing electronics. He has requested this loan in order to purchase those tools and to renovate his car. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  

Artur hopes for lenders' support and help so that he will be able to continue his business.

loans.use: to buy for tools for renovating electronics and to renovate his car

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa de 64 años de edad, solo alcanzo a estudiar hasta tercer grado, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos, 2 ya independientes y uno que vive con ellos, que solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado porque tuvo que dejar la escuela para trabajar con su padre.

Tiene una tienda donde vende golosinas, granos basicos, azucar entre otros; tiene 8 años trabajando en el comercio pequeño, anteriormente realizaba jornales en las algodoneras y cafetales. Lo de la tienda, surgió como iniciativa propia para obtener ingresos para su familia. El negocio lo tiene en su casa, su hijo le ayuda a atenderlo.

El prestamo lo utilizara en la compra de articulos para la tienda, con el fin de abastecer la demanda de productos de la gente de la zona y con ello mejorar sus ingresos.

Felipa quere en un futuro que su negocio se a fuerte y sostenible y heredarcelo a su hijo para que tenga con que vivir.
texts.en:
Felipa, 64, was only able to reach third grade of schooling, she has a partner and three children, two of whom are already independent and one who lives with them who could only study to sixth grade because he had to leave school to work with his father.

Felipa owns a store where she sells sweets, bulk grains, sugar and so on. She has been working in the small store for eight years, prior to that, she worked in cotton and coffee plantations. The idea of running a store arose from her own initiative, in order to obtain an income for her family. She runs the business in her home and her son helps her to run the store.

Felipa will use the loan to buy items for the store, with the aim of meeting the demand for products from people in the area, and therein improve her income. 

In the future, Felipa wants her business to be strong and health, and to pass it on to her son so that he has something with which to live.

loans.use: to buy items for the store (eggs, oil, sugar and so on).

loans.name: Lamech

texts.en:
Lamech is 29 years old and married to Fridah, who is a nurse bringing additional income to the family. He runs a retail shop and has been in business for two years. Right now his monthly income from the business is KSH 40,000. He is borrowing a loan of KSH 50,000 which he intends to use on purchasing more stock for his business. He plans to build a house with the anticipated profit. 

This is his first loan, and his hopes and dreams are to expand his business by opening another branch.

loans.use: to add stock to his business.

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr:
Madame Aïssata  est une vendeuse de légumes au marché local. Elle a démarré cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle sollicite ce prêt d'un montant de 100.000F pour  acheter des légumes : carottes, choux, pomme de terre, aubergine douce et aubergine amer, piment... En fait elle n’en manque pas, mais compte tenu de la période, sa clientèle en demande toujours davantage. Et pour ne pas rompre ce lien, elle décide d’être prudente et de disposer d’un fond  suffisant pour  ne pas être en rupture, car les clients pourraient aller voir ailleurs. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h.
 Avec les fruits de son activité, elle se  prend en charge elle même en même temps que sa famille. 
Son seul souci est d’avoir une bonne assise dans son commerce et pour cela elle a besoin des préteurs.
texts.en: Madam Aïssata sells vegetables at the local market. She started this business more than 10 years ago. She is requesting this loan in the amount of 100,000 F to buy vegetables: carrots, cabbage, potatoes, sweet eggplant and bitter eggplant, pepper... In fact she is not lacking in vegetables, but taking account of the period, her clientele is always requesting more. And in order not to break these ties, she decided to be cautious and to have sufficient funds not to have stock shortages, as her customers could go elsewhere. She starts her day at 8am and finishes at 6pm. With the fruit of her business, she takes care of herself at the same time as her family. Her only concern is to have a good basis in her business and for this she needs lenders.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and then resell them at the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise, hair gel, shoe shine, shampoo, toilet paper and so on in bulk.

loans.name: Lilian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lilian de 55 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene 4 hijos de los unicamente la hija de 17 años vive con ella, porque los otros se independizaron. Lilian no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, su pareja es agricultor.

Lilian tiene 20 años de trabajar la tierra con su esposo, con el fue que aprendio dicho oficio ya que no conocio a su padre. Antes de tener familia trabaja de jornalera en las fincas algodoneras.

El prestamo sera utilizado para comprar dos terneras, ella manifiesta  que la agricultura en este tiempo  no es tan rentable, cultivan solo para la subsistencia. Los altos precios de los insumos y el bajo valor de su producción, la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de invertir en ganado que le puede generar ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Sueña con tener su ganaderia y mejorar la alimentacion de la familia con los derivados de la leche.
texts.en:
Lilian, 55, has a partner and has four children, of whom only her 17-year-old daughter lives with her and the others grew up and moved out. Lilian did not have the opportunity to study, her partner meanwhile is a farmer. Lilian has been working the land with her husband for 20 years, it was with him that she learnt this trade as she didn't know her father. Before having a family, she worked as a laborer in the cotton plantations.

The loan will be used to buy two calves, Lilian asserts that at this moment in time, agriculture is not as profitable, they only harvest for their own subsistence. The high prices of supplies and the low value of her produce have led her to take the decision to invest in cattle which will generate an income to improve her living conditions.

Lilian dreams of having cattle and improve her family's diet with dairy products.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Peñitas Group

texts.es:
Doña Adelina o Ade, como es mejor conocida, es una mujer muy trabajadora pero sobretodo muy emprendedora su amabilidad es lo que la caracteriza. Ella forma parte del grupo Peñitas tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión libre con el señor Sixto. Juntos han formado una familia con tres hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando. Doña Ade tiene un invernadero desde hace ya nueve años esta vez está solicitando un crédito  a VisionFund y Kiva para poder comprar más semillas de cilantro, jitomate, zanahorias, lechuga, etc. Necesita del dinero para poder adquirir su material y continuar sembrando hortalizas; sin su crédito será más difícil comprar semillas que su costo se ha elevado mucho. Doña Ade platica como adquirió su invernadero “A mí siempre me ha gustado el campo, siempre quise tener un invernadero sin embargo no tenía el dinero suficiente para construir uno".  Para la estructura de un buen invernadero se necesita de un buen capital, comenta ella, "...pero no me quede con las ganas de sembrar verduras: armé un pequeño huerto con material desechable como palos delgados y algunos costales ya viejos para poder cubrir mis hortalizas". Doña Ade siempre trabajó con mucha dedicación para obtener buenas cosechas, pero un día tuvo la oportunidad de poder pedir un invernadero fue un apoyo por parte de un programa del gobierno. Para Ade, esta noticia fue muy agradable, el solo tener ya todo la estructura la cual es muy cara la hizo muy feliz. Doña Ade tiene ya nueve años con su invernadero en el cual siembra toda clase de verdura por varios meses ella se dedica a trabajar muy duro,  para después vender su verdura con sus vecinos nunca le ha gustado salir a vender en las plazas ni en los mercados. Con su venta le va muy bien porque sus vecinos le compran toda su mercancía, muchas veces ya no tiene que salir a vender porque llegan a su casa a comprarle. Sin embargo, el único reto de Doña Ade es la falta de agua para poder regar sus plantas, en la comunidad donde ella vive está prohibido utilizar el agua potable y cuando llueve capta toda el agua posible para utilizarla como riego en su invernadero. El verdadero problema es en tiempo de sequía muchas veces teme perder toda su cosecha. La meta de Ade es poder sembrar en cantidades grandes para poder vender o entregar a los señores directamente que se dediquen a la venta de la verdura, también desea llegar a tener un local propio en un lugar más céntrico para ella misma vender su verdura. 

Así como Ade tiene sueños los miembros del grupo también quieren cumplir los suyos es por eso que están solicitando un crédito para invertir en sus negocios: Bibiana en juguetes para los dulces de algodones, Juana en conejos, Ines en pollos y guajolotes, Luis en su taller, Irineo en avena, Andres en taxis, Martha en tienda de abarrotes y Virginia en ropa. El grupo Peñitas se encuentra en una comunidad muy hermosa lo que caracteriza sus arboles grandes también por lo general hace siempre hace mucho frio siempre, el grupo está integrado por 11 personas las cuales son muy trabajadoras y responsables siempre tratan de estar muy puntuales con para cualquier situación que se tenga que hablar con su grupo el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque así se llama la comunidad donde pertenecen y al parecer está en la lengua mazahua.
texts.en:
Doña Adelina or Ade, as she is better known, is a very hardworking and very enterprising woman who is characterized by her kindness. She is part of the group Penitas, is 31 years old, and lives with her common-law husband Sixto . Together they have formed a family with three daughters who are all in school. Ade has had a greenhouse for the past nine years and is currently requesting a loan from Kiva and VisionFund to buy more seeds of cilantro, tomatoes, carrots, lettuce, etc. She needs the money to be able to continue planting vegetables. Without the loan it will be difficult to buy the seeds because the cost has risen sharply. Ade tells us how she acquired her greenhouse: "I always liked working in the fields, I always wanted a greenhouse but had not enough money to build one." For a good greenhouse structure, she needed good capital , she says "... but I still wanted to plant vegetables. I built a small kitchen garden with disposable materials like thin sticks and some old sacks to cover my vegetables ." Ade always worked with great dedication to get good crops, but one day she had the opportunity to request a greenhouse from a government program . For Ade, this news was very welcome. Just having the structure (which is very expensive) made ​​her very happy. Ade has had this greenhouse for nine years and she grows all kinds of vegetables for several months. She works very heard and then sells her vegetables to her neighbors as she never liked going out to sell on the streets or in the markets. Her sales are very good because her neighbors buy all her merchandise. She often no longer has to go out and sell because they come to her house to buy. Nevertheless, the only challenge Ade faces is the lack of water to irrigate her plants. In the community where she lives it is prohibited to use the drinking water for crops so, when it rains, she captures as much water as possible to use as her greenhouse irrigation. The real problem is that in times of drought she often fears losing her entire crop. Ade's goal is to plant in large quantities to sell or deliver directly to her customers She also wants to have a stall in a more central location from which she can sell her vegetables.  
Ade has dreams and the other group members also want to fulfill theirs and this is why they are requesting a loan to invest in their businesses: Bibiana will invest in toys for cotton candy; Juana in rabbits, chickens and turkeys; Ines Luis in her workshop; Irenaeus in oats; Andres in taxis; Martha in a grocery store; and Virginia in clothes. The Penitas group is located in a very beautiful community that is characterized by its large trees and by the fact that it is usually very cold. The group consists of 11 people who are very hardworking and responsible and who always try to be very punctual in any situation where they need to get together and talk. They chose the name of their group because it is the name of their community and it is in the Mazahua language.

loans.use: to buy more seeds such as cilantro, tomato, carrots, lettuce, etc.

loans.name: Sergio Armando

texts.es:
Sergio es un joven muy trabajador, labora en una pequeña empresa de transporte de carga y filmaciones de eventos, cada día Sergio trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y los fines de semana puede trabajar hasta 12 horas, ya que filma en los eventos; Sergio cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y le gusta su trabajo.

Sergio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar los trámites de su título universitario, ya que el logro estudiar la carrera de administración, así el podrá buscar un mejor empleo y mejorar sus ingresos, y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un mejor empleo y ayudar a su familia”
texts.en:
Sergio is a very hardworking young man, he works in a small business  dealing with cargo shipping and the filming of events. Every day, Sergio works around nine hours a day and the weekends he can work up to 12 hours as he films at events. Sergio believes that he is doing well because he is responsible and he likes his job.

Sergio is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help given that he will be able to perform the formalities for his university degree as he was able to study a degree in business administration. In this manner, he will be able to find a better job and improve his income and continue fighting to achieve his greatest dream that of having a better job and helping his family.

loans.use: with higher education costs.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Chuluunbaatar, 38-years-old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts to make a living since 2008. His wife runs a grocery store. Their daughter goes to high school. Recently he has decided to run a new business by buying vegetables from the countryside at lower prices and then later sell them at a higher price. For this cause he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase vegetables in large quantities. He will store the purchased vegetables in his basement and sell them in winter, during this time the demand for vegetables increases drastically.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables from the countryside producers to sell on in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Ríos de Agua Viva está conformado por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables como con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos, les preparan platos típicos como “Nacatamales” lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a sus esfuerzos y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco comunal y tiene por actividad económica la venta de paca de ropa usada como pantalones, camisas, faldas, short, ropa de cama, ropa de dormir, pijamas, ropa de niño. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias, actividad que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Ríos de Agua Viva agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community bank Ríos de Agua Viva is comprised of 9 members, 8 women and 1 man. They are responsible mothers and fathers who have 15 children in their care. They are hardworking, responsible people with a desire to succeed. In their spare time, they enjoy the company of their children and they cook regional dishes such as "nacatamales" (a type of tamal). Unfortunately, they were not able to study because of a lack of economic resources and they were obliged to work from an early age in order to help with the household expenses. 
Thanks to their efforts and their desire to get ahead, the coordinator of the community bank works selling second hand clothes such as pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, bed clothes, pajamas, and kids clothes. She works about 10 hours a day from her own home. The goal of this loan is to gain working capital to supply her store selling second hand clothes so that, in the near future, she will have a better income. The community bank Ríos de Agua Viva is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people who have scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: with business capital and supplying their business with second hand clothes such as pants, shirts,skirts, shorts, bed clothes, pajamas, and kids clothes.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline hails from Nakuru. She is 47 years old, married to Peter who produces some additional income for the family, and has four children aged 24, 21, 18 and 13 years old.

She runs a motor vehicle spare parts and accessories shop which has been in operation for the last ten years and to enable her stock it better she has applied for her third loan of KES 80,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is KES 30,000 and she plans to use profits from her expanded business in constructing a house on a plot she owns.

She hopes that with a good and stable business, she will be able to enjoy old age when it strikes.

loans.use: To add a stock of motor vehicle spares and accessories to her shop.

loans.name: Babati Group

texts.en:
Robson is in his thirties and is single with one child.  His child goes to school.  He has a business selling shoes, radios, and mobile phones.  He has had his business for three years and works daily from 7:00am to 7:00pm.  He makes a fair profit each month.  

This is his ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  Robson used his previous loans to buy shoes, mobile phones, mobile phone covers, and radios.  He has paid back his previous loans successfully.  He used the profits to pay school fees, buy food for his family, buy a plot of land, and buy a sofa set.  He will use this loan to start a new business selling memory cards and TVs.  His dream is to build and buy a car.   

He will share this loan with his loan group "Babati" which consists of five members. The members of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start a new business selling memory cards and TVs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 34 years old, married to Joan and a father of one child aged four years old. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last two years earning a salary of KES 16,000. He learnt about KADET from other riders who have been financed by KADET.

David has been advanced a first loan of KES 94,157 which will enable him purchase his own motorcycle. This way he is likely to earn more due to the flexibility that comes with ownership. He will use the proceeds to pay school fees.

David's dream is to own a residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 32 years single with two dependants - his parents who are very old. He deals in cattle fattening and milking as his major source of income. He owns 40 cows of which the majority are for milk. Through income gained from milk sales Samuel has managed to look after his parents by providing them with medication and other basic necessities like food.

Samuel is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more cows to increase his milk production and also to buy veterinary drugs for spraying as well as feeding to his cows. He hopes this will improve their health and quality.

Samuel's major challenge is the dry season when there is inadequate grass to feed his animals and a lack of water leading to a decrease in milk supply.

His dream is to own a milk cooling plant in his region so that he can save people from moving long distances for this service. Samuel is hard working.

loans.use: to buy cows and veterinary drugs.

loans.name: Kandiatu

texts.en:
Kandiatu is 43 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is not married but lives with her boyfriend and has two children. She was not able to complete 9th grade due to financial issues. Her children aged nine and 19, they are currently in school. Her partner works as a teacher. 

Kandiatu has a business selling cosmetics, which she has had for nine years. Some days the business is good some others it is very slow. She started this business selling water and bread. Now she is proud to support herself and her children.  

Kandiatu has requested a loan to purchase more cosmetics to resell. In the future, she hopes to build a house. She wants to be in good health so she can pay back the money and keep supporting her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Mr. Batmunkh, 41 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. He has been working as a general manager at a consulting firm for one year. His wife is unemployed and looks after her children. He is requesting a loan of 7,700,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his house, thus creating a more comfortable and warm place. 

The family will burn less coal for heating as heat loss through walls and windows will cease. Burning of coal is the main source of air pollution in Mongolia according to state research.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Martha Aryera

texts.es: Martha, actualmente continua con su lucha de terminar de construir su casa, ella se encuantra laborando para una empresa distribuidora de Pan como cajera desdes hace 8 meses y cuando puede le dedica tiempo a su negocio de venta de ropa su esposo siempre le apoya con los gastos del hogar, con este credito construira un anexo ya tiene los bloques pero le hace falta los demas materiales que los compraran: cemento, arena, piedrin, perlines, zinc. gracias a KIVA Y AFODENIC que confiaron nuevamente en ella. Asi sus hijos creceran con las mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Martha is currently continuing with her struggle to finish constructing her house. She has been working for 8 months as a cashier in a bread distributing company and, when she can, she spends time on her business selling clothes. Her husband always supports her with the household expense. She will use this loan to build an annex. She already has the cinder blocks but she needs the other materials: cement, sand, gravel, zinc. Thank you to Kiva and Afodenic for trusting in her again so that her children will grow-up with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, a 31-year-old, married mother of four from Mwingi, earns a living for her family by operating a tailoring shop. She has been in this business for the past eight years and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000, which she uses to support her family. She also sells cereals on the side, a business that supplements her income. 

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD and she is grateful for the support she has been receiving which has made it possible to grow her business. She intends to use the loan to purchase more material to make clothes for her customers. Additional income created will allow her to stock more cereals in her cereals shop and repay her loan. 

She hopes to expand her businesses in the future and purchase a plot of land to construct a permanent residential house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more material for tailoring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his dormitory fee.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 29 years old. For the last five years, he has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. 

Boniface was introduced to KADET Ltd. by our credit officer, and is applying for his third loan of KES 30,000, to buy additional stock for his business such as dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his nephew's school fees as well as expand his business. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that he may improve his financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 34-year-old single woman. She has two children aged seven years and 15 years. She describes herself as humble and trustworthy. She operates a greengrocery where she sells groceries. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a water storage facility. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water barrel to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water barrel.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 39-year-old shopkeeper. He is married to Pasqulina and together they are blessed with two children aged 12 and three respectively. Antony has been running his retail shop for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 5,000 which he uses to meet the needs of his family. 

Antony is applying for his first loan term with KADET. He will use the loan to add more stock such as sugar, flour, stationery etc. With the expected profit from his business, he will pay school fees for his children and repay his loan with KADET. Antony hopes and dreams that one day he will have a sustainable business and build a good home for his family.

loans.use: To add more stock such as sugar, flour and stationery.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en: Jenneh is 42 years old and lives in the West Point area; she is a widow, and has four children.  All her children live at home and attend school. For the past four years she has been involved in the sales of candy, crew-gum and biscuits etc. Her main challenge is the low sales of goods during the rainy season. What she likes about this business is selling to customers and it makes her proud to be able to send her children to school. She has requested this loan to purchase more candy, crew-gum and biscuits etc for her business. In the future she would like to be a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more candy, crew-gum and biscuits etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plow her fields and buy seeds.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 48 years old. She is married to Bernard and they have been blessed with three children of the following ages: 25, 23 and 17 years respectively. She is a poultry farmer and she has been in business for five years. Right now her monthly income is KES 10,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 55,000 which she wants to use to buy feeds for the chicks. She plans to purchase a piece of land with the anticipate profit from the business. This is her sixth loan and she successfully paid back her previous loan.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for chicks.

loans.name: Mdidimua Group

texts.en:
Mercy is in her thirties and is single with two children. One child is in school and the other is a baby. She is running two businesses. One business is a shop selling dry foods and the other is a wholesale drink business. She has had her business for two years and works daily from 6:00am to 9:00pm.  Mercy is able to make a very good profit from her two businesses.

This will be here first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use it to increase her stock of drinks, which she sells at wholesale. Her dream is to build a house for renting.  

She will share this loan with her loan group "MDIDIMUA" which consists of 10 members.  The members of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of drinks which she sells wholesale.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah is 38 years old and she lives in the West Point area; she’s married with 3 children between the ages of 18 and 20. All of them live at home, and they are in school.  For the past 5 years, she has been involved in the sales of door locks, hinges, nails and other items. Her main challenge is the rise of the prices of goods. She started this business with a small amount of money and she learned it from her mother. She loves it when her customers buy from her, and it makes her proud to see her children in school. She has requested this loan to purchase more door locks, hinges, nails, and other items for her business. In the future she wants to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more door locks, hinges, nails, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Ineah

texts.en:
Inear, 56, is married, and he has children and 4 dependents whom he is looking after due to the death of their parents. He is an agriculturalist who majors in cattle fattening and coffee growing in his region. He gets a salary from teaching as another source of income apart from agriculture.

He has managed to look after his family and also help pay tuition for the four dependents after the death of their parents.

Ineah is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to improve the quality and look of his house, which is in very bad shape, by plastering, flooring and painting its rooms.

Ineah’s major challenge is his poor housing conditions at the moment, but he hopes to overcome it after he has gotten the loan.

His dream is to own one of the largest farms in his region and to produce 200 liters of milk a day. Ineah thanks Ugafode for allowing the disadvantaged to access low-interest-rate loans to improve their households.

loans.use: to buy paint and hire labor.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in the Likoni area near Mombasa, Kenya. She is married with two children. She owns rental houses and she is able to collect rent at the end of every month. She also sells "lesos" as part of the supplement business to increase her income. She has been in this business for more than 20 years and she has been surviving on this. She intends to add some more rooms so that she can accommodate more people and better her income.  

She knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy building materials like blocks and cement to add more rooms to his house. The challenge in the business are tenants sometimes not being able to pay the rent. She hopes the extra income will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy building materials like blocks and cement.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en:
Ferial is a 20-year-old single lady who has worked in selling accessories for six years ago to improve her living conditions. In parallel to her existing job, she is employed in a beauty shop, where she works hard to develop her business and improve her living situation. Her boss gives her permission to run her business from his shop, because he likes to have his customers pleased, and at the same time this new existing business attracts new customers.

To increase her business merchandise with a special released accessories collection, Ferial is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.

She hopes that one day she will be financially capable of opening her own accessories-selling shop.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special released accessories collection.

loans.name: Roxana Yanira

texts.es: Roxana de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia donde vende diferentes productos como: granos básicos, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, sopas, etc. con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Roxana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas productos para su tienda por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Roxana is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son.  Roxana runs a small shop out of her home, where she sells different products, such as basic grains, eggs, sweets, soft drinks, and soups.  With her profits, Roxana is able to cover some household costs. Roxana is applying for a loan in order to buy (in bulk) more products for her shop.  She can then earn higher profits and offer her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, eggs, sweets, soft drinks, soups, and more.

loans.name: Namjargal

texts.en:
Namjargal, age 26, lives with her mother in an old and deteriorating house in a fenced area in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a cook in a restaurant since 2009. Her mother has retired from work and gets a small state pension. 

The house they live in has deteriorated badly over the years and needs some serious repair. For this reason, Namjarga is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 MNT. She will use her loan funds to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass, and foam. Using these materials, she and her mother will repair and insulate their house. This will allow them to live in a warm and comfortable home where they can burn less coal and release fewer pollutants.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials to repair her deteriorating house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, underwear for men, women and children, socks, and more.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
Wilberforce is 45-year-old, married man with seven children.  He is hard-working and creative. He deals in coffee farming; he has about five acres of land on which he grows coffee to sell to nearby traders. He has been doing this business since his childhood. The business has helped him educate his children and construct for them a good shelter.  

Wilberforce would like a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy a generator to pump water in his plantation and fight against the dry season, which has left many people in tears. He is challenged mainly by weather and also traders who offer less for his coffee. His dream is to see all his children be educated and to buy a processing machine to improve the quality of the coffee he sells.

loans.use: to buy a generator to pump water for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, tiene 21 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con sus padres en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro. Su actividad anteriormente ayudaba a su padre a cuidar unas vacas y estudiaba. Hace un año que decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios como cargadores, baterías, protectores etc. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en un local donde alquila actualmente. El ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para poder surtir el negocio con nuevos productos de celulares y accesorios para incrementar las ventas y generar mejores ingresos. Su visión es ser un microempresario con visión a desarrollar proyectos a futuro.
texts.en: Wilfredo is 21 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the town of Negrito, in Yoro.  Before, WIlfredo helped his father to look after the cows, in addition to studying. A year ago, though, Wilfredo decided to start up his own business selling mobile phones and accessories, such as covers, batteries, chargers, and more.  Wilfredo's business is located in rented premises.  He is applying for a loan of 10,000 Lempira in order to stock up the business with new mobile phones and accessories, in order to increase sales and generate a higher income.  Wilfredo sees himself becoming an "micro-entrepreneur" and working on more projects.

loans.use: to buy new mobile phones and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en:
Fazil is 46 years old.  He lives in Azerbaijan in the Baku region. He has three children, two daughters and a son, who are 21, 20, and 15.  His elder daughter works as a chemistry teacher. The other daughter studies at the university on third course.  His son is educating at school on eights class.

Fazil is a taxi-driver. He began to work as a taxi-driver 7 years ago. Now he wants to purchase spare parts for his car and repair it. He needs 900 AZN for this, which is why he has applied to Kiva. He is thankful to Kiva for helping him.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Asatu C.

texts.en:
Asatu C. is 47 years old and lives in the West Point area. She’s married and has three children between the ages of 12 and 28 years old; only the younger one is attending school and living at home. Asatu C. attended school and finished in the 7th grade. 

For the past 10 years she has been involved in the sale of rice, pepper, oil, vita (a juice drink), etc. Her main challenge is the variable quality of the goods she buys. Business is also much slower in the rainy season. Asatu C. will use the money to buy more rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc. In the future, she wants to send her children to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old. She lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and was unable to go to school. She describes herself as a hardworking woman,  

For the past four years, Victoria has been selling pepper, vita, oil, onion, rice etc in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7AM to 5PM. She likes her business and the way customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared-taxi to get her goods to her business spot.  

Victoria is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, vita, oil, onion, rice, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children. She thanks the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, vita, oil, onion, rice, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por al calidad con que elabora cada prenda y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gasto que tiene un su hogar, doña Juana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de telas, agujas, hilos, botones, zippers, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juana, who is 54, lives with her partner and two sons in their own home.  She has been making clothing for a number of years, running her business from her home.  She has a large clientele because of the high quality of the clothes that she makes and her reasonable prices.  Her income from her business enable her to cover her household expenses.  Juana is now applying for a loan to buy fabric, needles, thread, buttons, zips, etc. so that she can continue her work and increase her income which will allow her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, thread, buttons, zips etc.

loans.name: Nagma

texts.en:
Nagma is a 39-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 3 children.

Nagma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband because her husband is a shoemaker by profession. He has been making gentlemen's shoes for many years. He makes shoes by hand. It is very hard work for a single person making shoes by hands. In the past, he was making shoes in a factory but getting low rewards for his efforts. Now he has opened his own shop in which he makes shoes but does not have enough amounts to buy raw materials for making shoes.

Therefore, Nagma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband could be empowered to buy raw materials and could grow his income. 

Nagma has many dreams which are not fulfilled yet. She has great hopes for her husband’s income. Nagma is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for shoe making, such as Rexine, glue, nails, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 28 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is unmarried and has 4 children between 1 and 8 years old. She described herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past three years she has been running a shop where she sells charcoal in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She used a pickup every time to get her goods at her business shop.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.  She'd like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 30-year-old married man with two children. Only one child goes to school.

He started cattle fattening in 2005 and he operates in a rural area. He began this business because he wanted to utilize the small piece of land that he has. He is a trustworthy person.

He would like a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more land for grazing so that he can increase the number of cattle he fattens. He is challenged by poor means of transport to take his cattle to urban centers for good income that will help him educate his future children since he is still producing. His dream is to see all his children educated.

loans.use: to buy grazing land

loans.name: In God We Trust 1 Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “In God We Trust I” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 3,900,000 SLL for the entire group in order to invest in their respective businesses.
 
Zainab is the featured leader of this group. Zainab is 40 years old. She is married with three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. Zainab sells palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil) and charcoal. She has  been doing this business for six years now. With the help of this loan, Zainab will invest in her business by buying gallons of palm oil and bags of groundnuts to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil and bags of groundnuts to add to her current stock

loans.name: Vencedoras Del Pinar Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Elvira, tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera, sin hijos. Ella es socia del grupo recientemente formado "Vencedoras del Pinar" formado por siete socios, cada uno de ellos cuenta un pequeño negocio.
Rosa Elvira, se encarga de la venta de productos naturales,actividad que realiza desde hace mas de 8 años y que le ha permitido tener independencia económica, organizar sus tiempos y lograr lo que la mayoría busca ser su propio jefe. Le agrada mucho éste trabajo ya que puede conocer gente y así aumentar su clientela.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos naturales los cuales al adquirir mayor cantidad, tiene un menor precio y así puede conseguir un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en: Rosa Elvira, who is 60, is a single and childless.  She is a member of the recently formed group "Vencedoras del Pinar".  There are seven members, each of whom runs a small business.  Rosa Elvira has been selling natural products for over 8 years and this has enabled her to achieve financial independence, organise her time and achieve what most of us would like to do: be her own boss.  She very much enjoys her work because it enables her to meet people and increase her clientele.  She will use the loan to buy natural products and, by buying them in larger quantities, will get a better price and thereby increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to increase their stock by purchasing natural products

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 31-year-old married woman. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, and is the mother of two children.
She is doing embroidery work by her hands at home and financially supporting her family. Saima belongs to a poor family; her husband’s income is very poor, so she decided to start embroidery work at home. She has been learning this art since her childhood, now she has adopted it for her occupation. She is proving herself to be an independent and brave woman for the sake of her children. 
Saima requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.
Her children are too young, so with the caring of them she is carrying on her embroidery work with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family.
Saima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sequins, colored threads and pearls for embroidery.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 34 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and completed the 5th grade. She described herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past three years she has been running a table where she sells pepper cala (a local fried doughnut). She sells six day a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m.  She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more flours, sugar, oil, pepper, etc., for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.  She'd like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more flours, sugar, oil, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Bunchie

texts.en: Bunchie is 34 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and has a 15-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. She described herself as a business-minded woman. For the past four years, she has been running a shop where she sells used clothes in the local market, she sells six days a week from 7AM to 6PM. She likes her business because she has inreased her income. She started this business with money given to her by mother. She uses a shard-taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans is to build a house for her children.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Benetta

texts.en:
Benetta, age 40, is a food vendor. She runs a table at the market where she offers such items as rice, oil, pepper, and onions for sale. She has been running her business six days a week from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. for the past three years. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. She started her business with money given to her by husband. She uses a shared taxi to transport her goods to her business spot. Benetta reports that she enjoys her business because she enjoys the interaction with her customers.

Benetta lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She and her husband have three children between the ages of seven and 20, two of whom are still in school and living at home.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more items such as rice, oil, pepper, and onions. 

Her goal is eventually to build a house for her children.  

She would like to say thank you to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase items needed for her business, such as rice, oil, pepper,and onions

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 38-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past ten years, has been running a business selling clothes. She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. 

She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a 20,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.

loans.name: Maria Encarnacion

texts.es: Maria de 40 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas y tortas desde hace varios años, su negoció lo tiene ubicado en la plaza que se encuentra cerca de su casa, posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su madre y sus dos hijos, doña Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, jamón, mayonesa, pan, quesillo, frijoles, etc. para seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, who is 40, has been makings and selling filled tortillas and pies for a number of years.  She does this a square close to where she lives.  She has a large clientele because she is friendly and her prices are reasonable.  She lives in her own home with her mother and her two children and her income is enough to cover some of her household expenses.  Maria is applying for a loan to buy corn, ham, mayonnaise, bread, soft cheese, beans, etc. which will enable her to continue her work and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, ham, mayonnaise, bread, soft cheese, beans, etc.

loans.name: Shareefan

texts.en:
Shareefan is a 49-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. 
Her son has been successfully running a small general store in the nearby town for many years. Shareefan wants her son's business to grow, so she requested a loan on his behalf from Kiva's field partner's BRAC Pakistan. This way, her son will be able to buy a increased stock stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. 
Because he is the only person responsible for her family and she has great expectations from him. He is her eldest son, and he is very caring and loving with his parents. 
With the profit amount she will arrange the marriage for her eldest son. Shareefan is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan, and is in her 7th loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting to boost in their earnings, and dreams of expanding the business further in the future.
She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner's BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the general store.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz, age 37, is the mother of five children. Her husband supports the family expenses. He is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but it is usually in poor condition and now it requires repairs and maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shehnaz has contacted Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband repair his rickshaw. With the loan funds, they will repair the engine’s piston, replace one wheel, and pay for labor. This will get Shehnaz's husband back on track with his business so he can drive more smoothly and provide functional and improved transport services to his passengers. 

Shehnaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Shehnaz says thank you to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for essential rickshaw repair and maintenance

loans.name: Elisee

texts.en: Elisee is 33 years old. He is married with three children aged between one and eight. Only two go to school. He sells breads and has owned a bakery for the past nine years. With the loan, Elisee would like to buy more bakery flour to make very delicious cakes and breads for sale. He plans to use the profits to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more bakery flour to make cakes and breads for sale.

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel is still perfectly managing his greenhouse occupation in Kapan city. He cultivates a great range of vegetables and greens (beans, cucumbers, onions, radishes, and different greens). Manvel’s wife helps him very much in the care of the greenhouse and vegetable cultivation. They have two sons - the elder son works as a baker at a bakery workshop and the second son is in the military service. 

Manvel has been engaged in the agricultural activities for thirteen years already, and he is already very skilled in this field. All the greenhouse products Manvel sells at the local wholesale market. 

Manvel has already successfully paid back his first Kiva loan, which he needed for the purchase of plastic and pipes to repair his greenhouse prior to the onset of cold weather, and to purchase seeds for sowing.

This time he asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian Drams to buy the seedlings of some new sort of cucumbers, and buy seedlings of tomatoes and Bulgarian peppers, which he didn't sell before.

loans.use: to buy the seedlings of tomatoes, Bulgarian peppers, and new sort of cucumbers.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran, age 33, is a married woman; she has been in the business of sewing clothes for many years. She has three children; all are schoolgoers. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. 

She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation. At the present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors with some packs of buttons and zippers to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with some packs of buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en: Musrat is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for five years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied a loan of PKR 30,000 through Kashf Foundation.  She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Leidy Elienaí

texts.es:
Leidy es una señorita de 20 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el Municipio de Panajachel.
Ella se dedica a la venta  de frutas preparadas,  que son colocadas en bolsas y de esta forma sale a ofrecer  en las oficinas y tiendas. Ella empezó este pequeño negocio porque su madre le enseño ya que sus padres siempre han sido comerciantes.
Comenta que ahora lleva 2 años en esta labor que es bastante rentable y productiva. A raíz de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias buenas que le ayudan a contribuir con la economía de su familia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de una carreta para su negocio, para poder brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Su sueño es seguir estudiando en la Universidad para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante y así mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Leidy is 20 years old and lives with her parents in the town of Panajachel.

Leidy makes a living selling ready-to-eat fruit, packed in bags that she goes round offices and shops to sell.  She started this small business after her mother taught her how - both Leidy's parents have worked in business before.

Leidy tells us that she has now been doing this profitable and fruitful work for two years.  She is earning good profits and an income which helps her to support the family's finances.

Leidy is applying for a loan of 3000 Qetzal in order to buy a cart for her business.  With this she can offer better service to her customers and, thus, increase her income.

Leidy's dream is to continue studying at university so that she can help her family get ahead and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cart to sell fruits.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak lives in Vanadzor town. He has been involved in the installation business for two years. Particularly he installs computers, cameras, and security systems, providing its maintenance and reconstruction.

Currently Artak collaborates with a local electronic shop, which provides Artak with clients. Now, to be able to enlarge his business and provide better service to the clients, Artak needs to purchase tools and camera testing equipment for making installation work. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Artak to be able to make his work more effective and purchase needed tools. Artak will be very grateful to lenders as the loan will greatly assist him.

loans.use: to pay for tools and camera testing equipment for making installation work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, medicines, basic grains, and more.

loans.name: Gabriela Milagros

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha, Gabriela es una joven muy luchadora es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando en la universidad la carrera de administración de empresas y para poder solventar sus gastos de estudios trabaja  en una institución de su ciudad como contralora, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y por las noches acude a su centro de estudios, ella cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad.

Gabriela está muy agradecida con el apoyo de los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá pagar las mensualidades de su universidad, de esta manera no tendrá problemas para ingresar a clases y seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su sueño:” Terminar su carrera  y ser una gran posesional”.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 19 years old and lives in the city of Chincha.  Gabriela is very feisty and so, with a lot of effort, is studying Business Administration at university.  In order to cover university costs she works for a local business.  Gabriela works some eight hours each day and, in the evenings, heads to classes.  She believes things are going well because she is a responsible young woman.

Gabriela is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to this support, she will be able to pay her monthly university fees.  She will thus have no problems going to classes, and will continue to fight to make her dream a reality: "To finish my degree and become a great professional".

loans.use: to pay monthly university fees.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor is 38-year-old woman. She has been running a business selling and purchasing animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices and brings them up. Then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Recently she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen is a married woman and a mother of seven children. She is 40 years old and has been involved in a bangles sales business for the past six years. Her husband is employed with too low an income to support his family alone. She serves her community well and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Now she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy a great variety of bangles in different colors and designs. She is expecting a boost in her sales and wishes to spend part of her profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy a great variety of bangles in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 46 years old. He is a father of nine children, and they all go to school. He has been selling different items in his boutique. With the aim of increasing the sales, he is getting another loan to top up the sales through adding new merchandise such as cooking oils, lotions, fruits and vegetables to earn better profits. 

He plans to use the profits for renovating the house.

loans.use: to buy more boutique items such as cooking oils, lotions, fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 43 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for five years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. 

When she was not earning, her family was going through sever financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner.

Parveen felt an obligation to change her family’s living standards, and started working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty fulfilling large orders. So she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors.

She expects boost in her earning, and wishes to spend part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
Ameeran is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales.

loans.name: Umme  Kalsoom

texts.en: Umme Kalsoom is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of the house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market. Over time she has become popular in her community for providing good quality products and makes enough to contribute to the household income. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase packs of biscuits, tea and cookies to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase packs of biscuits, tea and cookies.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 27-year-old poor lady; her family are passing through a very tough time.

In fact her husband drives an auto rickshaw which does not belong to him; he has to pay a daily fee to the owner of the auto rickshaw. To avoid the daily fee and to improve his daily income he decided to buy new vehicle to drive. But he is still short of some amount to buy the new vehicle.

Therefore, Nabeela requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a new auto rickshaw. 

Nabeela hopes that this loan will work out positively and her husband will have success buying his new auto rickshaw. In this way her monthly income will increase and her savings as well. 

Shakeela is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw, contributing some of her savings.

loans.name: The Eye Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “The Eye” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 2,600,000 SLL in order to buy more inventories to add to their respective businesses. 

The featured leader of this group is Jaka.  Jaka is age 35; she was born in Kono but she is currently residing in Waterloo together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a driver, and her children are attending primary school and secondary schools respectively. For many years now, Jaka has been selling clothes and shoes. With this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of clothes and shoes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes and shoes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen has just repaid his first Kiva loan, which was very useful and productive both for his business and his large family. He managed to buy brake shoes, headlights, engine oil, paint, instruments, etc. for his store. 

His elder son still lives with them; his second son and daughter already have children. His beloved wife continues to works at the library.  Armen runs his business in his native city of Kapan where he has lived since he was born. 

For some time Armen worked at a rented shop, but finally he managed to buy his own shop. Now he has a shop that is not very big, but very comfortable and suitable for his business. Here he sells spare parts for cars and the assortment is very large.
