This time Armen requests a loan of 700,000 AMD in order to do some repairs to his shop and renew the assortment spare parts.

loans.use: to repair his shop and renew the assortment of spare parts

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un humilde mecánico, el trabaja en la ciudad de chincha y inicio su pequeño negocio con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro, sobre todo porque tiene que sacar adelante a su esposa y a sus 3 hijos a quienes quiere mucho; Luis cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con sus clientes y honrado.

Luis agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar materiales de construcción y poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, así podrá dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su sueño:” darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Luis is a humble mechanic.  He works in the city of Chincha and started his small business with a lot of effort and saving up.  He started this business to help his wife and three children, whom he loves very much, to get ahead.  Luis thinks that he is prospering because he is very friendly and honest with his customers.  

Luis is grateful for this support being provided by Kiva lenders.  Thanks to it, he will be able to buy building materials and make improvements to his home.  He can then give his family a better quality of life and continue fighting to make his dream, of seeing his children become professionals, a reality.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy retail stock such as rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra, age 41, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.  

She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for her third loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma, age 31, deals in the business of milk sales. With the support of the Kashf Foundation and Kiva loans she has successfully built her business. By this time, she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She also works with animals to generate an extra amount of income. 

Currently she applied for her third loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase one more cow. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She wishes to utilize part of revenues on providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is 39 years old and she is a single mother of three. Two of her children attend school. For the last four years she has been in the hawking business and it is the only source of income for her and her family. She mostly sells women's clothes and she reaches her customers in their homes. She learned about Milango from her close business friend and she decided to join so that she could access credit to fund the business. 

She now seeks a loan to buy a stock of new clothes for her business. In five years time she wants to be running a successful boutique with enough stock of new clothes. The challenge in the business is finding customers during the low season. She will use the extra income she will raise to expand her business operations.

loans.use: to buy a stock of new clothes.

loans.name: Ekhlas Fayad Group

texts.en:
Ikhlas (wearing white in the picture) is the featured borrower of the Ekhlas Fayad group. She has joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and close friends.
 
Ikhlas, age 46, is the mother of three children. She sells plastic home products from her home, mostly preparation, storage, containment, and serving products for kitchen and home use. Her business needs support so that it can develop and expand, which is why she has applied for a loan. With her loan funds, she will be capable of increasing her business merchandise offerings with newly released products.
 
She hopes that one day she will develop her business to the point of being financially capable of opening her own separate shop outside her house.

She is joined in this loan group by Iman (pictured in the center) and Hanaa (at the left).

loans.use: to add newly-released products to her merchandise offerings

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula operates a kiosk shop business to earn a living. She has run her business for the past two years, selling her wares to her neighbors and passers-by. She names price fluctuation as her primary challenge.

Nyamvula and her husband have raised nine children, all of whom are now grown. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business. With her Kshs 30,000 loan funds, Nyamvula intends to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, sweets, biscuits, and cooking oil to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, sweets, biscuits, and cooking oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Al Wafaa Kfar Matta Group

texts.en:
Rajaa is the featured borrower of Al Wafaa Kfar Matta's group. She joined with her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, because they have been neighbors and friends for a long time.

She is a 49-year-old single lady, who has had a shop selling home products for three years. She used to work as a teacher before, but she wanted to depend on herself to develop her living and increase her income.

Thus today, she is acquiring a loan from Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special newly released home products that will attract customers' attention, and increase her income.

Rajaa is the lady with a red top. As for the other group members, Hala is the lady sitting on the left, and Mirna is the lady sitting in the center.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special newly released home products that will attract customers' attention.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been running her business of selling milk for many years. Over time, Nasreen has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She also works in animal sales on a seasonal basis. 

Nasreen's husband is employed in a textile mill but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Nasreen has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf foundation. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another cow. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 22-year-old married woman; she has been running a business purchasing and selling animals for the past two years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation.

Currently she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skills to provide for her family for over five years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community and to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase spools of threads, sequins and pearls in various colors. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Sumera has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, sequins and pearls in various colors.

loans.name: Kengne

texts.en:
Kengne is a Cameroonian lady aged forty-three and married with six children. The oldest is twenty and is at university and the youngest is seven years old and is in primary school. She has been in this business for the past twenty-two years which makes her very stable and experienced. 

This business will be successful because it is located in an urban area where the demand is high. She is likely to succeed because of her long experience in the business. This loan will help her increase her turnover from one hundred thousand CFA francs to two hundred thousand CFA francs per month and in addition, her living standard will increase

loans.use: to buy beauty salon products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and lives in West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and has two children aged 11 and 22; only one is in school and both of them live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. 

For the past three years she has been running a market-table where she sells fish in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7AM to 5PM. She like her business because of the ways customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by mother. She uses a shared taxi each time she needs to get her goods to her business location.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She plans is to build a house for her children. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Sri Krushna Group

texts.en:
Sabhya lives in the small village of Muniguda in the district of Rayagada, Odisha, India. She is a headstrong and confident lady. She hails from a poor family below the poverty line. The lady seated third from left in the photo, raising her hand, is Sabhya. She is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages about 19 and 16 years old.

Sabhya has been selling vegetables in the local market for the last 10 years with the handholding support of her husband. Nowadays, her monthly family income is about 6,000 Indian rupees (INR).

In the year 2011, Sabhya along with five women of her village formed a group to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their businesses. Now Sabhya wants a third cycle loan for the growth of her business. Sabhya wants a loan to purchase vegetables and fruits, such as tomatoes, brinjal [eggplant], carrots, potatoes, onions, garlic, zinger, green chillies, lemons, apples, and grapes, etc. In the future, she wants to expand her business and be a vegetable wholesaler.

Out of the other five members of the group, Rukmani and Kunti want a loan for their broiler business. Lalita and Basanti want a loan for selling vegetables and Sabitri wants a loan for a fruit business. All six members have established businesses and have the same economic status in society.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits, such as tomatoes, brinjal, carrots, potatoes, onions, garlic, zinger, green chillies, lemons, apples and grapes, etc.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana, aged 28, is a responsible mother living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is taking her first loan from BRAC; she is a new member, but she has agreed upon the terms and condition of BRAC.

Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with the scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been running his business for many years. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have the amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for getting money. Therefore, Rukhsana requested a loan for her husband, so that he could buy scrap iron, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 

Rukhsana is very impressed with this honorable support and expresses her wish to take a huge loan after this loan. She says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods for resale.

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 35-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working as a beauty therapist for 10 years. 

Mirvat is  a hard worker, well-known in the region because of her good customer service and talent.  She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the seventh cycle, in order to  start a new brides' dress renting  business. 

Through her previous loans, Mirvat was capable of buying new beauty cosmetics necessary for her business, and moving to a wider salon.She is a loyal wife, who works hard to help her husband with their living in order to provide their child with the best life.

She  hopes to give her child the best education and good health.  To accomplish this, she hopes to open a special wedding dresses shop, in addition to moving to a bigger working place, where she can expect a lot more customers.

loans.use: To start a new brides' dress renting  business

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky, age 26, sells school bags at her local market to earn a living. She likes her business because she is almost as fond of the children who buy her book bags as she is of her own child. She learned her business from her mother and started it up six years ago with a small amount of money given to her by her fiancé. 

Pinky lives in West Point with her child, age eight, who lives at home and attends school. 

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more book bags for her business. Eventually, she would like to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more book bags to offer for sale

loans.name: Muharram

texts.ru: Мухаррам опытная портниха и жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 31 год. Она разведена и живет с матерью. Мухаррам самостоятельная и независимая женщина. Она обеспечивает себя и мать за счет предоставляемой услуги швеи. Мухаррам в течение 5 лет у себя дома шьет на заказ женские национальные платья и получает хороший доход. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите. У них сломался холодильник и продукты, которые они берут уже через день портятся. Мухаррам решила взять кредит и купить маленький холодильник. Она будет выплачивать кредит за счет дохода с деятельности.
texts.en: Muharram is an experienced dressmaker and resident of Istaravshan.  She is 31 years old, divorced, and lives with her mother.  She is an independent and driven woman, providing for herself and her mother through her work.  For the past 5 years, Muharram has been sewing Tajikistani dresses to order, and makes a decent income doing so.  At the moment, she is in need of a loan; her refrigerator broke, and all the food inside is at risk of spoiling.  Muharram has decided to take a loan to buy a small refrigerator, and plans to pay her loan off with the money she makes from her business.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es: Dinora de 30 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su esposo,  sus dos hijos y sus dos hijastros, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales desde hace varios años, comercializa en su casa y también de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad con que los elabora, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, dinora está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, verduras, tomates, pollos, hojas de huerta para envolverlos y así seguir con su trabajo para tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Dinora is 30 years old and lives in a rented house with her husband, her two children and two step-children. For the past number of years her work has been making and selling tamales.  She sells them from her home and also peddles them throughout the surrounding neighborhoods. She has many clients because of the good quality of her product. From her earnings and with the help of her husband, they have been able to pay off some of their household 
expenses. Dinora is asking for a loan to buy corn, vegetables, tomatoes, chickens, and leaves to wrap up the tamales, thus continuing to work towards a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetables, tomatoes, chickens, and leaves.

loans.name: Juana Florinda

texts.es: Juana de 39 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela porque su producto es fresco, y a buenos precios, con lo obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Juana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras por mayor  para seguir con su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is 39 years old, a single mother, and lives in her own home with her three children. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the market that is located near her home. She has a large clientele because her product is fresh and well-priced. With what she obtains from her business she manages to pay some household expenses. 

Juana is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale. This will enable her to continue with her business and earn better profits to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives with his wife in Kapan city. They have three children; two sons and a daughter. His elder son and daughter are married and they live separately with their families. Their smallest son became seriously interested in football after military service and now plays in a football club. Ashot, as he used to, is engaged in agriculture and he cultivates various vegetables and fruits. Ashot cultivates beans, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, eggplant, zucchini, radishes, and greens. He also has apple and peach trees and several plum and pear trees. Ashot sells his garden’s harvest through the re-sellers or in wholesale market. This will be Ashot’s second loan from Kiva. He used the first one to build a concrete fence along his garden.

This time he asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to mold the soil and also to buy fertilizers for his vegetable garden.

loans.use: to mold the soil and also to buy fertilizers for his vegetable garden

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila, age 57, is the mother of five children. Her son owns a furniture shop in which he manufactures beds, sofas, tables, and chairs. Both of her sons have a high level of expertise in manufacturing furniture, having learned the trade from her husband, who made furniture for many years and who has now grown old and takes rest at home. Their practice is to make furniture on demand and then add polish to add shine, elegance, and value to the furniture.
 
The demand for new furniture has recently and suddenly increased and her son has spent all available funds on raw material. However, many important  wood items still need to be purchased, and he does not have enough to buy the remaining raw material.
 
For this reason, Jamila has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy the remaining inventory items needed.
 
Jamila is very thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan for their gracious support.

loans.use: To buy planks, chip boards, nails for making furniture.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

Mwanamkasi is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a very hard-working woman who wishes to get ahead through her own efforts and wants her working life to be much more successful. She is single and lives with her one child who goes to school.

Mwanasha has a business offering M-pesa services (mobile money transfer), a business which she has run for two years. In addition, she also runs a cloth business.

At present, Mwanasha needs to offer her customers better services. For that reason, she is requesting a loan through Yehu, to invest in the addition of electronic credits to sell in her M-pesa business.

loans.use: to invest in the addition of electronic credits to sell in her M-pesa business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Doña Estela, tiene 56 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene tres hijos, reside en una comunidad del Municipio de Choloma, Departamento de Cortés.
Hace mas de 6 años que Doña Estela se dedica a la venta de zapatos, sandalias y ropa como blusas, pantalones, vestidos, camisetas y otros. Este negocio lo tiene en su vivienda y también vende de manera ambulante.
Ella se muestra satisfecha con la forma en que obtiene ingresos para contribuir a la economía del hogar.  Actualmente ha solicitado otro préstamo que es por la cantidad de 12,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de más producto para surtir su negocio como ser ropa y sandalias y poder incrementar las ventas.
Tiene como meta hacer su negocio auto sostenible.
texts.en:
Estela, 56 years old, is in a common-law relationship, and she and her spouse have three children. She lives in a community in the municipality of Choloma, in the department of Cortés.

Estela has been working for more than six years selling shoes, sandals, and clothes like blouses, pants, tops and other items. She runs this business from her home, and she also sells door-to-door.

She is satisfied with this way of earning income to contribute to her household's finances. She is currently requesting another loan of 12,000 Honduran lempiras. She plans to invest in buying more products, like clothes and sandals, to stock her business and increase her sales.

Her goal is to have a self-sustaining business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals to stock her business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married and has three children--one in school and two underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a fish-selling business for the last three years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 35,000, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca de 35 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su hermana y sus dos sobrinos de 17 y 15 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida su negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico donde transita muchas personas, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos de los gastos de su casa, blanca eta solicitando un crédito par al compra de mesas, bancos, utensilios de cocinas, una nueva licuadora,  y materia prima como pollo, carne, arroz, verduras, etc.para elaborar los alimentos así aumentar sus ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Blanca, 35, lives in a relative's house with her sister and her sister's two children, ages 17 and 15. They are currently in school. She works selling food. Her business is located in a very strategic place, where many people pass by. From what she earns through her job, she can cover some of her household expenses. Blanca is asking for the loan to buy tables, benches, cooking utensils, a new blender, and ingredients like chicken, meat, rice, vegetables, etc, in order to make the dishes. This way she will increase her profits in order to have a better quality of life along with her family.

loans.use: to buy tables, benches, cooking utensils, a new blender, and ingredients like chicken, meat, rice, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 14, 7 y 5 años de edad, él es un hombre responsable con las obligaciones de su hogar y de su trabajo, desde hace 33 años se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, don José  esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar todos los insumos necesarios para su siembra como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, controles de plagas, etc. y así obtener una buena cosecha para ofrecer mejores productos a sus clientes y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their three children, ages 14, 7 and 5.  He is a man who is responsible with his home and work obligations. 

He has farmed for 33 years, mainly growing mainly corn and beans. He sells his crops in the area surrounding where he lives, and with what he earns  from his sales, manages to cover some household expenses. 

José is requesting a loan so that he can buy all the necessary supplies for farming, such as: fertilizers, manures, seeds, pest-control agents, etc. 

This will enable him to obtain a good harvest, offer better products to his customers, and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manures, seeds, pest-control agents, etc.

loans.name: Sausten

texts.en:
Sausten, age 57 and a widower, diligently operates his Zoona mobile money transfer business in rural Zambia. His business has been operating successfully for four years now. Sausten is the father of seven children and six grandchildren. He also runs a restaurant business.

This will be Sausten’s second Kiva loan. The first loan helped him to increase his customer base from 10 per day to 25 per day. His monthly revenue increased by over 300 percent. With these additional profits, Sausten was able to install electricity at his restaurant.  

Today, Sausten is requesting a second Kiva loan in order to open an additional Zoona outlet in Nyimba district, a small town in the eastern province of Zambia. This loan will serve as start-up capital to open the shop and start serving customers.  

Sausten would like to take this opportunity to thank Kiva lenders for their support. He hopes to continue to grow his business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to open an additional Zoona outlet in Nyimba district so that he can continue to grow his mobile money transfer buisness

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla, age 63 and widowed, has been running her convenience store business for the past seven years. Her business allows her to make her living and cover her living expenses. She is a woman with a very good reputation in her area, and she is a borrower in good standing with Kiva partner Al Majmoua. 

Layla is requesting her fifth loan. She will use her loan funds to enhance her business merchandise with special-offer products, and to diversify her products in order to satisfy the requirements of her customers, thus increasing her income.

Her previous loans helped her a great deal in expanding her inventory, allowing her to add several new products. She is investing much hope in this current loan, and is hopeful that it will fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.use: to enhance her business merchandise with special-offer products

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a twenty-eight-year-old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda.She sells firewood and also operates a retail shop in order to earn a living. Stringent laws on tree cutting and inadequate capital are her major challenges, while her dream is to diversify business and venture into solar business. Gladys intends to use the loan to buy firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Vrej

texts.en: Vrej has been involved in a delivery business for about 10 years. He has agreements with local schools and delivers bakery products and napkins to them. As the school holidays have already gone, and the academic year has already started, Vrej needs financial support to be able to purchase new stock of bakery products and napkins. Vrej has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. However, Vrej needs this loan to be able to purchase supplies. The loan will greatly assist Vrej to earn income for his wife and two children.

loans.use: to pay for bakery products and napkins

loans.name: Samaria

texts.en: Samaria lives in Montserrado County in the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 30 years old and is married with six children between 4 to 26 years old; they have been in school and live at home for the past years now. She has been selling book-bags in the local market. She started this with resources given to her by her husband, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She enjoys the ways customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more book-bags for her business. In the future she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more book-bags for her business

loans.name: Pola

texts.en:
Pola is a divorced woman with one child who is underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuations as her major challenge. Pola dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, maize flour, bread, sweets, biscuits, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, maize flour, bread, sweets, biscuits, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Divino Niño Sauce Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Divino Nino el Sauce está conformado por diez integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con 12 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de la compañia  de sus hijos, y pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Karen es la coordinadora del banco comunal y tiene por actividad económica la venta de fritanga ubicada en su casa de habitación, una fritanga es la venta de comida casera como carne asada, pollo asado, tacos, gallo pinto, tajadas, maduros, queso frito, manuelitas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias en la preparación de la comida y la venta de la misma. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos  comestibles para la fritanga, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Divino Nino el Sauce agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabaja digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Divino Nino el Sauce is made up of ten members, eight women and one man, responsible mothers and fathers with 12 children under their care. They are originally from Sauce, a place that is located in the western area of the country. They are characterized by being responsible and hard-working, with the desire for self-improvement.  In their free time they like to enjoy the company of their children and spend quality time with them. Unfortunately, they were not able to study and they saw themselves as obligated to work from a young age.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to succeed, Karen is the coordinator of the communal bank and works in a fritanga that is located in her home. A fritanga is a restaurant that sells home-cooked food like roasted meat, roast chicken, tacos, gallo pinto, tajadas, ripe plantains, fried cheese, and manuelitas. She dedicates around 10 hours a day to her business, preparing and selling the food. 

The objective of the loan is to invest in work capital and supply her business purchasing and selling food products for the fritanga, for which in the not-too-far future she will be able to receive a better income. The communal bank Divino Nino el Sauce is thankful for the help the Kiva lenders provide to people of few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, so they are able to have a dignified job.

loans.use: to invest in work capital and supply her business purchasing and selling food products for her restaurant, such as chicken, tomatoes, red meat, lettuce, cream, tortillas, plantains, potatoes, and ripe plantains.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 43 years old. She is married with four children. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salt, and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings and renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and rice for sale.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is an ambitious man with 10 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He runs a depot of soda and beer but also makes bricks in order to raise money to support his growing family. Customers not paying on time and high transport costs pose a challenge to his business growth. The good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university level and build a permanent residential house for them. David requests a loan to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado County. She is 40 years old and has four children aged between 11 and 23 years old who are in school and live at home. For the past four years she has been selling rice, pepper, palm oil, and other items on a table. One of the problems she faces is the rainy season. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes having her business makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, and other items for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, and other items for her business

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
The six members of this group are both single and married women and a man, who average 36 years of age and two children each. They all live in the same neighborhood in Teshie in the Republic of Ghana. 

They all are in their second loan with ID-Ghana, and they repaid their first loan without trouble. They sell fruits, vegetables, provisions, cosmetics, and mobile phone credit cards. 

Mary is a fruit seller, and she has been doing this work for three years. She is standing third from the left in the photo. With her loan amount of GHS 600, she intends to purchase watermelons, pineapples, bananas and oranges, so that she can sell it to customers. She plans on making a profit of GHS 200 from this loan. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, and also to help her husband on their housing project. Together, the group is taking a total amount of GHS 3,500 which will be used to purchase various items to boost their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase watermelons, pineapples, bananas, and oranges, so that she can sell it to customers.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a 37-year-old man. He lives alone in the Bolnisi district. Romeo is currently unemployed and he wants to begin a dairy products business. In Bolnisi district, it is very popular to have animal husbandry businesses and many families have cows and produce dairy products.

Romeo is requesting a 1,200 USD loan to purchase a stock of dairy products to resell in different villages using his minibus. He hopes to purchase dairy products every day. Romeo’s loan is part of the start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo. His loan will help Romeo to start a business and generate income to receive financial support.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, age 31, sells clothes to earn an income. She has operated her business for the past five years. 

She will use her loan funds to buy men's and women's clothing items to offer for sale. She will reinvest the expected profits into her enterprise so that she can bring about a successful future for the business.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu, age 38, runs a "cook shop" (a small restaurant business) at the market. She has run her business for the past three years. She cites high prices of goods as her primary business obstacle. She enjoys her business because she enjoys interacting with her customers. She is grateful for the profit it brings her because it allows her to support her family, and she is proud of the success of her business.

Fatu has five children between the ages of eight and 20 years old. The family lives in West Point, one of the most populated areas and home to the most well-known market in Montserrado county.

Fatu is requesting a loan in order to purchase such items as chicken, rice, oil, spare ribs, pig's feet, and chicken feet for her cook shop.

Her dream is to grow her business and to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase such items as chicken, rice, oil, spare ribs, pig's feet, and chicken feet for her cook shop

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomas es un hombre casado de 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus 8 hijos de los cuales son; 3 hombres,  el mayor se dedica a la sastrería y los otros 2 se dedican a estudiar  y al mantenimiento de la milpa y las 5 mujeres, 3 de ellas se dedican al mantenimiento de la casa y las otras 2 son menores de edad,  quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
El  actualmente es sastre,  ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura pero por situaciones económicas, decidió obtar por esta actividad que le ha generado mejores ingresos y ganancias.
Comenta que lleva 18  años en esta labor que le ha ayudado a contribuir en la economía de su familia, por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de materiales de construcción para poder remodelar su vivienda. Este préstamo lo pagara con los ingresos y ganancias que le genera la actividad que realiza.
Su sueño es terminar la construcción de su vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas is a married man of 37. He lives in Sololá department with his eight children. He has three boys: the eldest does tailoring and the other two go to school and help maintain the family's plot of land. He has five girls: three of them help with the household chores and the other two are minors. 

He is currently a tailor; previously he worked in agriculture, but because of economic circumstances decided to opt for this activity, which has generated greater income and earnings. 

He comments that he is been doing this work for 18 years which has helped to contribute to the family's finances, so now he is requesting a loan of 3,000 quetzals to buy construction materials so that he can renovate his house. He will pay this loan with the income and earnings that he generates from his business. His dream is to finish building his home so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Famatta

texts.en: Famatta lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is 22 years old, single, and has three children between 1 and 8 years old--two are in school and all of them live at home. Her husband is a businessman. For the past three years she been selling soft drinks and cold water in her community. She got money from her mother to start this business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks and cold water for her business. She wishes to buy a plot of land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and cold water for her  business.

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en:
Seryozha is from Gyumri town where he lives with his parents. He works delivering bread to local shops. Despite his young age, Seryozha is a very skilled driver who has many years of delivery experience. He realizes that his income is very important for his family, and he would like to expand his business. Seryozha uses a rented car to deliver bread but he is saving money to purchase a micro-truck. 

Seryozha is requesting a loan to purchase a new truck to deliver bread. He has not been able to save enough money because of his family’s daily needs. Seryozha’s request has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. This start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses without access to credit products.  His loan is very important for Seryozha and will help him to continue his delivery business. The support and help of lenders will be a huge benefit for Seryozha and his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new truck to deliver bread

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos con son menores de edad, la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales y cal  para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
The client has been selling tortillas from her home for several years. She works from Monday to Sunday and has a large clientele, as she is a very hard-working and friendly person. With the earnings she gets she manages to pay the household expenses. 

She lives in her own home with her husband and their three children, who are minors. She is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal (a quintal is approximately 100 lb.) and lime, so that she can continue making the tortillas. This way she can obtain better earnings, enabling her and her family to have greater financial stability.

loans.use: To buy corn by the quintal and lime.

loans.name: Swazi Twebiseho Group

texts.en: Esther, the only woman in her loan group, is applying for her seventh loan to buy organic fertilizers to improve the productivity of her tea garden. She is a resilient, hardworking woman. Esther and her family have relied on the income from her tea garden for many years but unfortunately, the soil that she cultivates has long ago lost its fertility, so she must rely on fertilizers to improve her productivity. Esther has five children, all of whom attend school. She is thankful that Ugafode has always been there in her time of need.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to improve the productivity of her tea garden

loans.name: Sri Ram Group

texts.en:
Kamala lives in the small village of Muniguda in the district of Rayagada, Odisha, India. She belongs to a poor family below the poverty line. The lady seated at the extreme right in the photo, raising her hand, is Kamala. She is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three sons and a daughter-in-law.

Kamala has been selling vegetables in the local market for the last 10 years with the handholding support of her husband. Her monthly income is about 6,500 Indian rupees.

In the year 2011, Kamala along with five women of her village formed a group to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their businesses. Now they want a third cycle loan for the growth of their businesses. Kamala wants a loan to purchase vegetables and fruits, such as tomatoes, brinjal [eggplant], carrots, potatoes, onions, garlic, zinger, green chillies, lemons, apples, grapes, bananas, etc. She will also invest part of the loan for repair of the roof of the shed. By doing this, she will get more space for stock.

Out of the other five members of the group, Nisha, Banita, Brundabati and Khira want a loan for their vegetable vending and Sairendri wants a loan for her fruit business.


.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits, such as tomatoes, brinjal, carrots, potatoes, onions, garlic, zinger, green chillies, lemons, apples, grapes, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 38 years old and married with four children between the ages of 21 and 24. Only one of her children attends school and lives at home. Sarah lives with her family in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado County. For the past 10 years, she has run a cafe where she sells rice and soup. Sarah’s business problems include the rainy season since she doesn’t have a good location. She enjoys interacting with her customers and making a profit.

Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, fish, meat, pepper, oil, and other ingredients for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, fish, meat, pepper, oil, and other ingredients

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en: Sophie is 46 years old. She is a mother of seven children and is married to a truck driver. She sells various types of merchandise in her boutique and has been running this business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, sugar and rice to sell in her boutique.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, sugar and rice to sell in her boutique.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 31 years old. He is single. He owns a boutique and has been in the business for the past seven years.   

With this loan, Emmanuel would like to buy more boutique items such as sugar, rice and sweets and chewing gum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate Emmanuel's house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and chewing gum to sell.

loans.name: Mavah

texts.en: Mavah is 39 years old and lives in the Paynesville South area of Liberia, one of the populous areas in Montserrado County. Mavah is single and has three children between 4 and 15 years old. Her children are in school and live at home. Mavah was able to complete 12th grade before starting her business over eight years ago. She has been running a cook shop, selling rice and soup in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, pepper, charcoal, oil, fish, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, charcoal, oil, fish, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has been a teacher since 1990. She teaches at a local school and also provides additional lessons at home. Anna lives with her grown-up children, and her husband works abroad and tries to support his family financially. 

Currently, the income that Anna gets from her business is very important for the whole family. Unfortunately, there are no facilities in her house for providing classes to her students, so Anna has applied to SEF for the help. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Anna to purchase tables, chairs and notebooks and will make her work with students comfortable and effective. Anna hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tables and chairs and notebooks.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has no children. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a food-selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Eva's Group

texts.en: Eva, who is in her early 40's, is married with two children, a boy and a girl, who are in school. Eva has been selling beans and rice for seven years. She works from 8 AM to 6 PM every working day and is able to make a very good return. This is her seventh loan request of GHS 1,000 from ID-Ghana which she will use to buy a two big bags of rice and beans which she will sell to customers. All of her previous loans were repaid successfully. Eva used her business profit to cover school fees and household expenses. She dreams that one day she will be able to build her own house. She is collecting this loan with four others. Caroline sells slippers, Theodora sells gari (processed cassava), Salomey sells provisions, and Abena sells second hand clothing. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan amount of GHS 5,900.

loans.use: to buy two big bags of rice and beans which she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Dolores Maria

texts.es: Doña Dolores es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora  vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo quien actualmente estudia, hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de accesorios decorativos (bisutería) como: collares, aritos, pulseras, llaveros, etc.  con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Dolores solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales hilos, perlas de colores, diferentes tipos de piedras, cristales, colgantes, etc. para poder seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias y con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dolores is a very responsible and hard-working person.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her son, who is currently in school.  For several years she has been making and selling decorative accessories (costume jewelry) like necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and key chains, etc.  With what she gets from her business she is able to pay for some of the household expenses.

Dolores is requesting a loan to buy materials like thread, different colors of pearls, different types of stones, crystals, and pendants, etc.  She will do this in order to be able to continue with her work.  This way she will get better income with which she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread, different colors of pearls, different types of stones, crystals, and pendants, etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don Juan es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en casa alquilada con su esposa y su hijo quien estudia actualmente, hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, adicional a eso también trabaja de albañil, con lo que obtiene de su negocio y con el pago de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Juan solicita un crédito para la compra de pollos de engorde, concentrado e insumos para su crecimiento, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Juan is a very responsible and hard-working person.  He lives in a rented house with his wife and his son, who is currently in school.  For several years he has been raising and fattening chickens.  He also works as a bricklayer.  With what he gets from his business and the payment for his work, he is able to pay for some of the household expenses.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy chickens to fatten, concentrated feed, and supplies for their growth.  With this he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten, concentrated feed, and supplies for their growth.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Doña Maria de 63 años de edad es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en casa propia con su esposa, hace varios años se dedica a su tienda, posee mucha clientela por  la variedad de productos que tiene, la amabilidad y buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como: papel higiénico, granos básicos, huevos, aceite, refrescos, etc. con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, age 63, is a very responsible and hard-working person.  She lives in her own house with her husband.  For several years she has had a store.  She has a lot of clientele because of the variety of products that she has, her friendliness, and the good prices.  With what she gets from her business she is able to pay for some of the household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business.  She will buy things like toilet paper, basic grains, eggs, cooking oil, and soft drinks, etc.  With this she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, basic grains, eggs, cooking oil, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.en:
Marie Therese is a 34-year-old married lady who has been working from her house for eighteen years preparing and selling handmade crafts and special occasion souvenirs for her living. She loves her business a lot and works hard to develop it by releasing new items and themes where she works to attract the customers' attention so that they will request more.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business tools and necessary souvenir needs and be able to use new released themes and designs. She hopes that one day she will be capable of affording to open her own handmade souvenir shop that will attract more customers and develop her business widely.

loans.use: to increase her business tools and necessary souvenir needs and be able to use new released themes and designs

loans.name: Santos Ceferino

texts.es: Don Santos es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, vive solo en casa propia, hace varios años  se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol y adicional a esto trabaja de albañil, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo  logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Santos solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así seguir con sus cosechas y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Santos is a very responsible and hardworking person. He lives alone in his own house. For several years, he has worked in agriculture, planting corn and beans. In addition, he works as a builder. With his earnings from his work, he is able to meet some of his household expenses. Santos is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies like seeds, fertilizer, manure, insecticides, herbicides, etc. This way he will continue with his harvests and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like seeds, fertilizer, manure, insecticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis has been involved in this stone workshop for five years. He is a stone abrasive worker and is already very skilled in that sphere. Sargis lives with his parents, wife, and two little children. He works hard to sustain his family's living and provide them appropriate living conditions.

Now this hardworking and honest man needs financial support.  With this loan's help, Sargis will be able to purchase tools and equipment for his stone workshop and gather more income. As the current machines in the workshop are already very old and needs to be replaced with new ones, this loan will greatly assist Sargis. He hopes for lenders' support.

Sargis has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for  stone workshop

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

She has operated a food selling business, making beans, and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Theobard

texts.en: Theobard is 32 years old. He is married with two children. The loan will be used to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a bar for a better future of the business. He has a dream to become a distributor in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Narcisse

texts.en: Narcisse is 24 years old. He owns a boutique and has been running the business for the past two years. He wants to buy more soda, beer, sugar, and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house in the future after the savings have been accumulated.

loans.use: to buy more soda, beer, sugar, and rice for sale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a hard working woman who struggles to meet the demands of her family. She appreciates your previous loan that helped her to boost the income of her business. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 60,000 to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking oil, and sugar for sale. She appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cooking oil, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi operates a food selling business. She sells in a grocery from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, and rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, sugar, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en: Besik is a 27-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in the capital city of Georgia. Besik and his wife are unemployed now. His relatives help them with money. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living. So, he decided to start a taxi business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times, as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. Besik received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $1200, he will pay a toll for his car, which he has purchased already. He will serve local people as a taxi driver and generate income.

loans.use: to pay a toll for his car

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en:
Hannington is a repeat client at the branch who has applied for a loan of ugx 1,000,000. He lives in a rural area in Kyabugashe Nyakagyeme – Rukungiri with his family of four children and a wife. He is majorly involved in agriculture. He grows coffee and bananas which he has done for many years to earn a living. He also rears goats and pigs as his additional income. He has managed to raise his income to meet his family needs, and pay school fees for his children and some orphans left behind by his late brothers.

His dream is to buy more land to increase his agricultural activities, and to buy a pick-up to transport his products to market and also fetch manure to fertilize his land.

His main challenge is lack of capital to meet his customers demands, especially piglets and kids (baby goats) that he will breed and later sell. Therefore he wants this loan to address that challenge.

Despite the above mentioned challenges, Hannington is a hardworking man and determined to change his future through proper agricultural practices.
In the photo is Hannington with his wife.

loans.use: to buy baby pigs and goats to breed and later sell

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una panadería en su lugar de habitación, tiene mucha clientela por su amabilidad a la hora de vender, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad que le ha dejado muchas ganancias que le han servido para cubrir algunos de los gastos que se le presentan en  el hogar , doña María está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de latas, levadura, harina, azúcar, etc. para la elaboración de los alimentos y así poder seguir obteniendo buenas ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su hijo.
texts.en: Maria, 57, lives in her own house with her son. She has a bakery in her home. She has a lot of customers because she is friendly when she is selling. She has been doing this work for several years, which has given her a lot of profits. This has helped her to cover some of the expenses that come up at home. Maria is asking for a loan to buy cans, yeast, flour, sugar, and more to make the food, and this way be able to keep earning good profits to have greater economic stability with her son.

loans.use: to buy cans, yeast, flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Veredianne

texts.en: Verediane is 49 years old. She sells shoes and clothes. She has spent ten years in the business. She wants the loan to buy more clothes and shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a thirty five year old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal,Uganda. She sells tomatoes in order to earn a living but also earns a salary as a civil servant. The fact that tomatoes are highly perishable and a lack of efficient preservation equipment pose a challenge to her business growth, while her dream is to venture into commercialized tomato growing. She wishes to educate her children up to the University. Sarah intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is from Kapan town where he lives with his parents. He has been involved in retail business for many years. Particularly, Robert sells clothing from his home to locals and gathers income. This source of income is the only for the family, so it is very important for Robert to sell more clothing and be able to cover his family's costs. 

Now Robert asks a loan for purchasing new stock of clothing for selling it to customers. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan is very important for Robert to increase the stock of clothing and meet his clients' demand.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of clothing for selling it to customers

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

For the past six years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients where perishable goods can lead to losses.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Egidienne

texts.en: Egidienne is 31 years old. She is married with five children. With the loan, she would like to buy more peanuts and flour for sale. She expects to use the profits for saving to get a driving permit for her husband.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pots, pans, rice and oil.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARIA AUXILIADORA” iniciará el trigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marisol es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa usada, venta de refrescos, venta de galletas, artesano de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marisol es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa y cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una tía hace diez años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones.
texts.en: The Maria Auxiliadora communal bank will start their thirty-first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional hub. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a governing board, where Marisol is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members have are varied. Among them are a neighborhood store, clothing sales, cosmetics sales, used clothing sales, soft drink sales, cookie sales, and shoemaking. The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-business owners. Marisol is a member of this group. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, joining by invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling clothing and cosmetics. She says that she learned this business from an aunt ten years ago. The loan that she will take out is to increase capital (buy clothing) which she will buy wholesale at the traditional fairs and later sell in her establishment. This kind of work lets her earn income to support her family, since she is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a constructor with 9 years of experience. He is making different types of sculptures, gravestones from stones and other materials and he sells them to locals. Due to the high quality of his work, Artur has many customers who value his professionalism and the beauty of his sculptures.
 
Artur is making Armenian "khachqars" well-known; "khachqars" are highly demanded in each Armenian household. Now, to make more items, Artur needs financial support. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Artur in purchasing gravestones and stones for making different sculptures and selling them locally. Artur hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for gravestones and stones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es: Doña Maria de 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia, junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 16, 15 y 6 años de edad, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, adicional a eso  se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de atoles, es una persona dedicada a su trabajo, amable con buena moral, gracias a todas estas características ha logrado una gran demanda en la venta de sus productos y sus cosechas, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas  ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de formula, sulfato, semillas, abonos, etc.  para el cultivo de maíz, y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se  merece.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and three children aged 16, 15 and 6 years old. She has been growing corn for several years. When the harvest is ready she stores it in silos like the one in the photograph. In addition to this, she also sells all kinds of atoles (hot drinks made with cornflour). She is dedicated to her work, friendly, and has good morals. Thanks to these characteristics she has managed to gain a large demand for her products and her crops. With the income from her sales, she has managed to cover a lot of her household bills.

Doña Maria is asking for a loan so that she can buy formula, sulphate, seeds, fertilizer etc. for growing corn, and in this way increase her income so that she can give her family the quality of life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy formula, sulphate, seeds, fertilizer etc.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit has been involved in tthe retail business for 5 years now. She is selling clothing and dressmaking supplies from her house and gathering income for her family. LIlit is a mother of two little children (the elder one is in the photo) and lives together with her husband.

Now this hardworking mother needs financial support to be able to purchase new stock of clothing and meet her clients' needs.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Lilit to be able to meet client demand and earn higher income for her family.

She hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for selling to customers

loans.name: Watta

texts.en: Watta is a 36-year-old woman live in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She did not attend school; she is single with 8 children between 15 to 21, two of her children are living on their own. For the past 6 years she has been selling spoons, bowls, and plates in the local market. Sometimes sales are slow, but most of the time she realizes profit and she uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more spoons, bowls, and plates for her business; she hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons, bowls, and plates for her business

loans.name: Mayamu

texts.en:
Mayamu lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 40 years old and married, with two children ages 15 and 17 who are in school and live at home.
For the past year she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita (a juice drink), and other items. She received a little amount from her husband to start this business, and she learned this way of trading from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita, etc. to expand her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita, etc. to expand her business

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a private entrepreneur from the village of Lernagog in Armavir region. She lives with her daughter and son. The latter has migrated to Russia as he couldn't find any employment opportunities in his homeland to be able to take care of the family. 

Gayane currently runs a small local store where she sells different grocery products, some clothes, and glassware. The assortment of goods she sells in the store is not that big and needs to be updated from time to time in order for the store to function properly. 

Gayane now needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase new goods (grocery products, clothes and glassware) to resell in her small store. She and her family greatly rely on the goodwill of the lenders who support them to collect the needed amount of loan to sustain their small business.

loans.use: to purchase new goods (grocery products, clothes and glassware) to resell in her small store.

loans.name: Amalia Patricia

texts.es:
Amalia es una mujer casada de 29  años de edad, madre de dos niños de 7 y 3 años de edad, quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Una mujer trabajadora que lucha junto a su esposo para sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que se encuentra ubicado a un costado de su vivienda. 
Ella empezó esta actividad desde hace 5 años ya que en su comunidad no había ni una tienda cercana,  es por ello que tomo la iniciativa de emprender este negocio para que las personas tengan todo lo necesario sin tener que salir a otro lugar.
Comenta que esta actividad le ha generado buenos ingresos y ganancias que le han servido para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de productos de consumo diario, solo de esta manera podrá darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es generar más ganancias para poder construir su vivienda y así brindarle una mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Amalia is 29 years old, and married with two children aged 7 and 3. They live in the Sololá department. She is a hard working woman who struggles alongside her husband to get their family ahead. Currently she has a grocery store which is located next to her house.

She started the business 5 years ago, since in her community there was only one shop nearby, and so she took the initiative to start the business so that people would have everything they need without having to go elsewhere.

She says that this work has been a good source of income and that it has been enough to cover their household expenses. This is why she is now asking for a loan of 5,000 GTQ to buy everyday consumable goods. Only this way will she be able to give her customers a better service.

Her biggest dream is to increase her earnings so that she can build her own home and so make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 48 years old from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 17-25. For 20 years now, she has been engaged in fish vending and operating a Sari-sari store. Edna hopes to expand her business and finds hope in the loan. She is requesting 5000 PHP to buy additional stocks of canned goods, chips, candies, shampoo, coffee and detergent, fresh fish and food for her family.

In the future, she hopes to see her children successful with their studies.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, chips, candies, shampoo, coffee and detergent, fresh fish and food for her family

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 44-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. For five years, she has been operating a clinic. She started the business in order to bring medical services nearer to the community since most public hospitals were far. 

A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children to attend degrees as minimum qualification, and expand her medical services to the nearby communities. 

Rebecca intends to use the loan facility to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en: Aram is from the city of Goris, which is in Armenia's Syuniq region. His family consists of his wife, daughter and son. He works in the private sector, for a construction company. The family's main breadwinners are Aram and his daughter, who also works in the private sector, but their salaries are not enough to fully cover the family's daily expenses. Aram generates additional income by breeding piglets and growing grass. He currently wants to develop his livestock-breeding business to find new sources of income for his family. To reach that goal he needs a loan of $2,000 to buy two cows. His enlarged herd will help the family take care of its needs more effectively. He and his family will be very thankful to all the lenders who help them collect they money they need to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Astaluz

texts.en:
Astaluz is a 50-year-old single woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. For three years, she has been practicing agriculture and earning a salary as a civil servant.

A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the university and set up sustainable income-generating activities for them. She also desires to venture into commercialized agriculture despite inadequate capital.

Astaluz intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sajama Group

texts.es:
